objects.name: Ports

fields.name: creation_time
fields.comment: The time at which the network port started listening on the endpoint.

fields.name: dest
fields.comment: The endpoint on which the port is listening.Expression: if(isnull(dest) OR dest="","unknown",dest)

fields.name: dest_port
fields.comment: Network port listening on the endpoint, such as 53.

fields.name: process_guid
fields.comment: The globally unique identifier of the process assigned by the vendor_product.

fields.name: process_id
fields.comment: The numeric identifier of the process assigned by the operating system.

fields.name: src
fields.comment: The 'remote' system connected to the listening port (if applicable).

fields.name: src_port
fields.comment: The 'remote' port connected to the listening port (if applicable).

fields.name: state
fields.comment: The status of the listening port, such as listening, etc.

fields.name: transport
fields.comment: The network transport protocol associated with the listening port, such as tcp, udp, etc.

fields.name: transport_dest_port
fields.comment: Calculated as transport/dest_port, such as tcp/53.

fields.name: user
fields.comment: The user account associated with the listening port.

objects.search_constraints: tag=listening tag=port | eval transport=if(isnull(transport) OR transport="","unknown",transport),dest_port=if(isnull(dest_port) OR dest_port="",0,dest_port),transport_dest_port=mvzip(transport,dest_port,"/") | mvexpand transport_dest_port

fields.name: action
fields.comment: The action taken by the endpoint, such as allowed, blocked, deferred.

fields.name: cpu_load_percent
fields.comment: CPU load consumed by the process (in percent).

fields.name: dest
fields.comment: The endpoint for which the process was spawned.

fields.name: mem_used
fields.comment: Memory used by the process (in bytes).

fields.name: os
fields.comment: The operating system of the resource, such as Microsoft Windows Server 2008r2.

fields.name: parent_process
fields.comment: The full command string of the parent process.

fields.name: parent_process_exec
fields.comment: The executable name of the parent process.

fields.name: parent_process_id
fields.comment: The numeric identifier of the parent process assigned by the operating system.

fields.name: parent_process_guid
fields.comment: The globally unique identifier of the parent process assigned by the vendor_product.

fields.name: parent_process_name
fields.comment: The friendly name of the parent process, such as notepad.exe.

fields.name: parent_process_path
fields.comment:
The file path of the parent process, such as C:\Windows\System32
otepad.exe.

fields.name: process
fields.comment: The full command string of the spawned process. Such as C:\WINDOWS\system32\cmd.exe /c ""C:\Program Files\SplunkUniversalForwarder\etc\system\bin\powershell.cmd" --scheme"

fields.name: process_current_directory
fields.comment: The current working directory used to spawn the process.

fields.name: process_exec
fields.comment: The executable name of the process.

fields.name: process_hash
fields.comment: The digests of the parent process, such as <md5>, <sha1>, etc.

fields.name: process_guid
fields.comment: The globally unique identifier of the process assigned by the vendor_product.

fields.name: process_id
fields.comment: The numeric identifier of the process assigned by the operating system.

fields.name: process_integrity_level
fields.comment: The Windows integrity level of the process.

fields.name: process_name
fields.comment: The friendly name of the process, such as notepad.exe.

fields.name: process_path
fields.comment:
The file path of the process, such as C:\Windows\System32
otepad.exe.

fields.name: user
fields.comment: The user account that spawned the process.Expression: if(isnull(user) OR user="","unknown",user)

fields.name: user_id
fields.comment: The unique identifier of the user account which spawned the process.

fields.name: vendor_product
fields.comment: The vendor and product name of the Endpoint solution that reported the event, such as Carbon Black Cb Response. This field can be automatically populated by vendor and product fields in your data.

fields.name: action
fields.comment: The action performed on the resource.

fields.name: dest
fields.comment: The endpoint pertaining to the filesystem activity.

fields.name: file_access_time
fields.comment: The time that the file (the object of the event) was accessed.

fields.name: file_create_time
fields.condition: action=created | stats count, count(file_create_time) as field_count
fields.comment: The time that the file (the object of the event) was created.

fields.name: file_hash
fields.condition: action=created or action=modified | stats count, count(file_hash) as field_count
fields.comment: A cryptographic identifier assigned to the file object affected by the event.

fields.name: file_modify_time
fields.condition: action=modified | stats count, count(file_modified_time) as field_count
fields.comment: The time that the file (the object of the event) was altered.

fields.name: file_name
fields.comment: The name of the file, such as notepad.exe.

fields.name: file_path
fields.comment:
The path of the file, such as C:\Windows\System32
otepad.exe.

fields.name: file_acl
fields.condition: action=acl_modified | stats count, count(file_acl) as field_count
fields.comment: Access controls associated with the file affected by the event..

fields.name: file_size
fields.comment: The size of the file that is the object of the event, in kilobytes.

fields.name: process_guid
fields.comment: The globally unique identifier of the process assigned by the vendor_product.

fields.name: process_id
fields.comment: The numeric identifier of the process assigned by the operating system.

fields.name: user
fields.comment: The user account associated with the filesystem access.

fields.name: vendor_product
fields.comment: The vendor and product name of the Endpoint solution that reported the event, such as Carbon Black Cb Response. This field can be automatically populated by vendor and product fields in your data.

fields.name: action
fields.comment: The action performed on the resource. Expected values: created, deleted, modified, read.

fields.name: dest
fields.comment: The endpoint pertaining to the registry events.

fields.name: process_guid
fields.comment: The globally unique identifier of the process assigned by the vendor_product.

fields.name: process_id
fields.comment: The numeric identifier of the process assigned by the operating system.

fields.name: registry_hive
fields.comment: The logical grouping of registry keys, subkeys, and values.

fields.name: registry_path
fields.comment: The path to the registry value, such as \win\directory\directory2\{676235CD-B656-42D5-B737-49856E97D072}\PrinterDriverData.

fields.name: registry_key_name
fields.comment: The name of the registry key, such as PrinterDriverData.

fields.name: registry_value_data
fields.comment: The unaltered registry value.

fields.name: registry_value_name
fields.comment: The name of the registry value.

fields.name: registry_value_text
fields.comment: The textual representation of registry_value_data (if applicable).

fields.name: registry_value_type
fields.comment: The type of the registry value.

fields.name: status
fields.comment: The outcome of the registry action.

fields.name: user
fields.comment: The user account associated with the registry access.

fields.name: vendor_product
fields.comment: The vendor and product name of the Endpoint solution that reported the event, such as Carbon Black Cb Response. This field can be automatically populated by vendor and product fields in your data.

fields.name: description
fields.comment: The description of the service.

fields.name: dest
fields.comment: The endpoint for which the service is installed.

fields.name: process_guid
fields.comment: The globally unique identifier of the process assigned by the vendor_product.

fields.name: process_id
fields.comment: The numeric identifier of the process assigned by the operating system.

fields.name: service
fields.comment: The full service name.

fields.name: service_dll
fields.comment: The dynamic link library associated with the service.

fields.name: service_dll_path
fields.comment: The file path to the dynamic link library assocatied with the service, such as C:\Windows\System32\comdlg32.dll.

fields.name: service_dll_hash
fields.comment: The digests of the dynamic link library associated with the service, such as <md5>, <sha1>, etc.

fields.name: service_dll_signature_exists
fields.comment: Whether or not the dynamic link library associated with the service has a digitally signed signature.

fields.name: service_dll_signature_verified
fields.comment: Whether or not the dynamic link library associated with the service has had its digitally signed signature verified.

fields.name: service_exec
fields.comment: The executable name of the service.

fields.name: service_hash
fields.comment: The digest(s) of the service, such as <md5>, <sha1>, etc.

fields.name: service_id
fields.comment: The unique identifier of the service assigned by the operating system.

fields.name: service_name
fields.comment: The friendly service name.

fields.name: service_path
fields.comment: The file path of the service, such as C:\WINDOWS\system32\svchost.exe.

fields.name: service_signature_exists
fields.comment: Whether or not the service has a digitally signed signature.

fields.name: service_signature_verified
fields.comment: Whether or not the service has had its digitally signed signature verified.

fields.name: start_mode
fields.comment: The start mode for the service.

fields.name: status
fields.comment: The status of the service.

fields.name: user
fields.comment: The user account associated with the service.

fields.name: vendor_product
fields.comment: The vendor and product name of the Endpoint solution that reported the event, such as Carbon Black Cb Response. This field can be automatically populated by vendor and product fields in your data.
